channel.title: Banner images cut off :/
channel.description:
[quote="kate@morcreative.net"] Hi Caue, hope you are well~
I am running into an issue on the basis med site gallery banners you put together a hill back…it seems all the sudden the container height for the banner image has gotten shortened? can you please take a look and tell me what my have gone wring? the images are being cut off https://kate-bosse-87i3.squarespace.com/config#/|/partners <https://kate-bosse-87i3.squarespace.com/config#/%7C/partners> https://kate-bosse-87i3.squarespace.com/shopproducts/ <https://kate-bosse-87i3.squarespace.com/shopproducts/>
I believe the banner height used to be set the same as all the other static banners on the site (https://kate-bosse-87i3.squarespace.com) but now that doesn’t seem to be the case?
Thanks so much! Kate
M O R C R E A T I V E KATE BOSSE WWW.MORCREATIVE.NET DIRECT: 813.235.5093 [/quote]

item.title: Banner images cut off :/
item.dc:creator: @Kate Kate
item.description:
@Kate wrote:

Hi Caue,

I have a follow up question on the CSS question below. I am wondering what the cost would be for you to add in 3 buttons on the header of the bryant template that have the ability to “pop up” with a form that says “coming soon” and have a space to leave an email address?

Does this make sense?

Thanks! Kate

Read full topic

item.title: Banner images cut off :/
item.dc:creator: @Kate Kate
item.description:
@Kate wrote:

Beautiful!

Thank you so very much Caue!

I have a project coming up that I have a question for you on… I am using the Bryant template for a client site. Can you add in multiple buttons on the header image instead of just the one that I can achieve using the site description box?

If so, what would be the cost to have 4 buttons across the header? Could you make this happen with CSS?

Thanks so much! Kate

Read full topic

item.title: Banner images cut off :/
item.dc:creator: @cregox Caue Rego
item.description:
@cregox wrote:

Hey @Kate, I'm fine and you?

I'm not sure what happened there, but I noticed it was not only being cut off, the bottom was also with an extra room. Like a misplaced puzzle piece. I quickly fixed it by changing the height() in this line into outerHeight():

    topRef = $('header#header').outerHeight();

So I suppose something was changed on the header that made the previous code not work, but this is how I should have done it to begin with anyway.

Hope that's all.

Read full topic
